author: sky.cactus
content: Anyone have a gist of what happened in the meeting last night (this morning for some)?

author: lightclient
content: <@!301186049323958275> nothing was exactly decided upon as there weren't really enough people for consensus. The people on the call were happy to limit the discussion-to field to github issues and eth magicians. I mentioned that I was okay with removing the implementation section in general, but I feel like it can be useful in some circumstances - particularly ERCs.

author: sky.cactus
content: How does the optional Reference Implementation section I proposed sit with you (where the reference implementation must be inline or in `../assets/eip-####/`)?

author: sky.cactus
content: Does that satisfy your desire to keep the implementation available, or are there use cases for it that don't fit into that?

author: lightclient
content: I think making it optional is good. I'm a little up in the air about allowing a reference impl as an asset (vs. inline), but I don't think I have a strong enough feeling against it to not support it

author: sky.cactus
content: The thing I want to discourage/prohibit is people linking to external repositories for "implementations".

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm fine with a reference implementation that is included as part of the EIPs repository in some way (asset or inline and CCO licensed), I just dislike external links in EIPs.

author: sky.cactus
content: So any solution that solves for that problem likely will make me happy.
